propertyChanged

public void propertyChanged(TokenizerPropertyEvent)
Description copied from interface: TokenizerPropertyListener
Event handler method. The given TokenizerPropertyEvent parameter contains the nessecary information about the property change. We choose one single method in favour of various more specialized methods since the reactions on adding, removing and modifying tokenizer properties are often the same (flushing cash, rereading information etc.) or not very different.
A TokenizerProperties object calling its listeners should do this in the order the listeners were registered with the TokenizerProperties.addTokenizerPropertyListener(de.susebox.jtopas.TokenizerPropertyListener) method.

Specified by:
propertyChanged in interface TokenizerPropertyListener
Parameters:
- the TokenizerPropertyEvent that describes the change

getData

public char[] getData()
Description copied from interface: DataProvider
This method retrieves the data range the active DataMapper should use for its operations. The calling method of the DataMapper should be aware that the provided array is probably the input buffer of the Tokenizer. It should therefore treat it as a read-only object.
Use this method in combination with DataProvider.getStartPosition() and DataProvider.getLength(). Characters outside this range are invalid.
For a more secure but slower access, use the method DataProvider.getDataCopy() to retrieve a copy of the valid character range.

Specified by:
getData in interface DataProvider
Returns:
the character buffer to read data from

getDataCopy

public char[] getDataCopy()
Description copied from interface: DataProvider
This method copies the current data range of the Tokenizer providing the DataProvider into a character buffer. Use this method if data should be modified.
The copy contains only valid data starting at position 0 with the length of the array returned. Don't use DataProvider.getStartPosition() or DataProvider.getLength() on this copy.
An alternative to this method is Object.toString() which should therefore be overridden in implementations of this interface.

Specified by:
getDataCopy in interface DataProvider
Returns:
a copy of the valid data of this DataProvider
See Also:
DataProvider.getData()

getLength

public int getLength()
Description copied from interface: DataProvider
Retrieving the maximum number of characters in the array provided by DataProvider.getData() that can be analyzed by the calling DataMapper.

Specified by:
getLength in interface DataProvider
Returns:
true if the given character is a separator, false otherwise

getStartPosition

public int getStartPosition()
Description copied from interface: DataProvider
Retrieving the position where the data to analyze start in the buffer provided by DataProvider.getData(). The calling DataMapper must not access data prior to this index in the character array.

Specified by:
getStartPosition in interface DataProvider
Returns:
index in the character array returned by DataProvider.getData(), where data starts
